programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Part one of two. Riker goes looking for Picard, who has failed to return from an archaeological trip - only to be told he has been vaporised in a bar-room brawl. However, his attempt to bring the killers to justice leaves him in the clutches of ruthless mercenaries. Patrick Stewart and Jonathan Frakes star

programme.desc: Part two of two. The search for fragments of an ancient Vulcan super-weapon reaches its end, as Riker wins the mercenaries' confidence by helping them attack the Enterprise, but his reward is a challenge to kill Picard. Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes and Robin Curtis star

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew members are unsure how to react when they are visited by a delegate from a foreign species who have no concept of spoken language, and whose only means of communication appears to be telepathy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard and Dr Crusher are imprisoned and telepathically linked by an alien race, forcing them to confront their mutual attraction. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.desc: An experiment to turn a ship invisible during the Second World War leads to it disappearing without trace. Decades later, an attempt to repeat the procedure brings the vessel back. A surviving crew member is found on board who has not aged a day and is convinced the process will lead to disaster if not stopped. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Nicholas Lea and Malcolm McDowell

However, the bloodsuckers are not the only threat, as a crazed fundamentalist cult proves even more dangerous. Action thriller, with Nick Damici and Connor Paolo

After tracking the youths down, Avery demands the parents take action against the youths but after being turned away, he decides to dish out justice by any means necessary. Thriller, starring Brian Cox, Noel Fisher, Tom Sizemore and Kyle Gallner

Action comedy prequel, starring Michael Gross, Sara Botsford and Billy Drago

programme.desc: Kirk's reunion with an old friend turns sour thanks to the presence of a group of Klingons. William Shatner stars

Action thriller, starring Craig Fairbrass, Jason Patric and James Caan

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DC Mickey Webb and FDO Robbie Cryer are taken prisoner by Ron Gregory and sleazy solicitor Warren Napier, who clearly have nothing to lose now their secret has been discovered. PCs Des Taviner and Gemma Osbourne hear a murderer's confession under highly unusual circumstances, while away from the line of duty, CSU officer Jim Carver decides to end his relationship with Marie Graham

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Nick Klein's gnawing cocaine addiction affects his concentration as he attempts to discover why two distressed senior citizens seem unaccountably afraid of the police, arousing the suspicions of maternal Sergeant Sheelagh Murphy, who's working on the case with him. Meanwhile, DC Brandon Kane's ex-wife Tanya makes the mistake of asking to see increasingly barmy PC Cathy Bradford about the possibility of getting back with him, setting the scene for a violent confrontation. Eric Sykes guests

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DC Ken Drummond and DS Debbie McAllister are assigned to investigate how TDC Brandon Kane's ex-wife Tanya came to grief and soon realise her terrible fall was no accident. Unfortunately, having concluded a third party was involved, they focus their suspicions on Brandon himself rather than PC Cathy Bradford does all she can to mislead them

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DS Debbie McAllister concludes that TDC Brandon Kane pushed his ex-wife Tanya down a flight of stairs and sets about trying to persuade DI Colvin that he's the prime suspect, while PC Cathy Bradford packs her bags and books a taxi to the airport, convinced she has no option but to flee the country. Out on the beat, PC Gemma Osbourne catches a shoplifter _ only to find she's a celebrity whose fame may protect her from prosecution

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's a bad day for PC Gemma Osbourne as she defends herself against allegations of assault made by notorious shoplifter Sandie Booth, especially when her sexuality is brought into play _ but the worst is yet to come. PC Nick Klein's drug addiction is spiralling out of control, leaving him in severe debt and desperate for his next hit, while hunky Aussie PC Cameron Tait investigates a burglary, where it soon becomes clear that the glamorous victim is very keen to take down his particulars

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An unusual advertisement appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local gazette, purporting to reveal details of a forthcoming murder, including the date, time and venue. It appears to be a morbid practical joke, but proves shockingly accurate. Puzzled by the mystery, and with more suspects than he can shake a stick at, Inspector Craddock quickly enlists Miss Marple's help in solving the crime. Joan Hickson stars

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the murder of a B-movie director when the production of Demon Brides comes to Kembleford. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sid falls for the heiress to a local brewery, only for her to be arrested for the murder of her own father. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates an on-set murder when Great Slaughter plays host to a summer roadshow for kids' TV programme 'Jolly Roger'

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Jonathan uses his intuitive powers to help the US government investigate the strange disappearance of an alien skeleton supposedly discovered in New Mexico, which has vanished from under the noses of the soldiers guarding it. Mystery, guest starring John Shrapnel and Charlie Brooks

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Maddy's former colleague starts poking her nose into an unsolved murder at a spooky old house, so the investigative duo tag along. While foraging for clues, Maddy somehow vanishes into thin air, leaving Jonathan to solve her disappearing act and the apparently motiveless killing of an elderly hermit. Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin star, with guest appearances by Jim Bowen and Lysette Anthony

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler and the team desperately try to prevent the copycat killer from re-enacting Jack the Ripper's final murder. With modern policing techniques proving no use to the investigation, the officers are forced to rely on instinct to crack the case their 19th-century predecessors could not solve. Thriller, with Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler and the team investigate another set of apparent copycat killings, with Buchan claiming the murders mirror those committed by notorious London gangsters Ronnie and Reggie Kray in the 1960s. The case stirs up uneasy feelings for Miles, who refuses to believe Buchan's theory. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Steve Pemberton and Phil Davis

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The cop is on a knife-edge as he tries to cover up a death, appease the suspicious Baba and protect Jenny from any further harm. But his problems do not end there - with a killer at large whose actions are ruled by a roll of the dice, he has no way of predicting the next move. Despite a moment of doubt, he puts his plan into action - and is dragged deeper into the criminal world than ever before

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Catherine and Shaf call in at Far Sunderland Farm to visit Alison and Daryl, but discover a scene of carnage when they enter the building, with a blood-soaked Alison slumped on the dining table having taken an overdose. Meanwhile, Andy and Jodie begin to suspect that the person who killed Vicky Fleming could be someone on the team and as the investigation heads towards a conclusion, John's torment increases, leading him to take drastic measures to avoid the consequences of his actions

programme.title: The Line of Beauty
programme.desc: The year is 1987 and Mrs Thatcher has again been returned to power. Political scandal engulfs the Fedden house and revelations about Nick force a confrontation with family members. Drama adapted by Andrew Davies from Alan Hollinghurst's 2004 Booker Prize-winning novel, starring Dan Stevens, Tim McInnerny, Hayley Atwell, Alex Wyndham and Alice Krige

programme.desc: The staff must deal with a hysterical woman threatening to kill a baby, and a health inspector is unimpressed with Holby General

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A girl's disappearance prompts the team to call in retired sergeant Bob Cryer, who knows the suspects better than anyone - but his services are soon dispensed with when it becomes clear his old-school methods aren't suited to modern policing. Undeterred, the veteran plod teams up with his niece, Sun Hill's front desk officer Robbie, to finish the job. Meanwhile, PC Gemma Osbourne ponders her future at the station following her attack, and drug-addled PC Nick Klein's fellow coppers raid the house where he is taking his first dose of crack, with the help of Sgt Boyden's daughter Amy

programme.desc: Spencer strikes lucky with Kelly on his 18th birthday

programme.desc: Flambeau enlists Fr Brown's help to steal the Queen's coronation gift from the Pope. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia's reckless driving lands her in the next hospital bed to Mrs McCarthy - with a killer on the loose. Mystery, starring Nancy Carroll and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates an apparent suicide, believing the death of a recently returned RAF pilot to be murder. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Comedy drama series from A Touch of Frost writer Richard Harris. Detective Constable 'Dangerous' Davies is an obstinate traditionalist used to being given bottom-of-the-pile jobs at his north London station until a routine inquiry offers him a lead in a 20-year-old unsolved murder case. Enlisting the help of his eccentric drinking buddy Mod Lewis, the mild-mannered detective sets out to prove himself to his colleagues. Peter Davison and Sean Hughes star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: Historical drama exploring the events that led to the Easter Rising in 1916, from the point of view of a group of friends living in Dublin, Belfast and London. The outbreak of the First World War has an overwhelming impact on Ireland, and as it becomes clear that the campaign will last for many years, social stability is eroded and nationalism comes to the fore

But the case takes on a different dimension for PC Gary Best when he discovers that colleague PC Nick Klein was also in the taxi that dropped the little girl off. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a pair of tired chairs, a collection of garden cast-offs and a chest of drawers for her and the team to rejuvenate at Altrincham Recycling Centre

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple who are looking for a forever home in Norfolk after having fallen a little more in love with each visit

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Janine from Merthyr Tydfil calls in the Garden Rescue team to help her create a wildlife friendly garden in the bare and boring new build plot she has with a budget of just 5,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Chelmsford to help a family of four who are overwhelmed by their home. They have 24 hours and a minimal budget to transform and clean their neglected house

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Angellica Bell present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola's family gather to say their goodbyes as her condition worsens but Honey and Phil are struggling to get Billy released from the police station. Callum finally gets through to Ben and Sonia calls an ambulance for Kim after she collapses after getting overwhelmed by a fan

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Preston and Kai give the school something to talk about and the school poetry slam gets off to a rocky start. Amy comes face to face with her crush after an awkward encounter and a technical faux pas exposes everything

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Finals week begins with the four hopefuls heading to Istanbul, where they are paired up to cook two local dishes rooted in centuries of tradition, mentored by one of Turkey's best-known chefs - Refika Birgl. They then work a busy lunch service with chef Fatih Tutak at Turk - the only restaurant in the city to have been awarded two Michelin stars - before cooking lunch for the British Consulate General and various other guests, including three judges from the Turkish version of MasterChef

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: A young couple's dreams come true when they inherit a beautiful country house, only to find it's falling apart and inhabited by many of the deceased previous residents

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: After falling down the stairs and suffering a concussion, Sam now sees the ghosts, and the ghosts try to think of ways to convince her they really are there

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A musical review of this season's FA Cup, ahead of the final between Manchester City and Manchester United, which takes place at Wembley Stadium on Saturday

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs are joined by singer-songwriter Cat Burns as they go live on TikTok to showcase as many make-up tricks as they can with just one product to impress beauty CEO, P Louise. At Glow Up Studios, the judges want to see looks inspired by the tribes, lifestyles and cultures the contestants relate to. In the Face Off, the bottom two MUAs have to produce a black outlined glossy lip

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letters X, Y and Z, concluding her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sammi Kinghorn presents the first of three visits to a hill farm in Cumbria, where 16-year-old shepherd Katie recruits her for springtime chores and assisting with a surprise birth. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Diana Yates demonstrate how to produce home-made fertiliser using comfrey, while George Anderson has an update from his own garden in Joppa and Beechgrove's head gardener Scott Smith reveals how to spot when seedlings are ready for potting on

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Tweed Forest Park in the Borders, where he finds out how it is being future-proofed against climate change and extreme weather events. Arlene Stuart visits dairy cattle near Dumfries that are being studied to assess how 'happy' they are, while Cammy Wilson meets a couple who have developed their own environmentally friendly, organic chicken feed. Anne Lundon is on the banks of the River Tay working her way through the biggest reed beds in the country and hearing how they benefit both people and nature

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don journeys to the Mediterranean, the cradle of European civilisation, for the next stage in his horticultural tour. In Italy, he witnesses the elaborate stone and water gardens created during the high Renaissance. He also investigates the influence of Moorish culture on European gardens, visiting the Aguedal in Marrakesh, and Spain's magnificent Alhambra

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: New families the Bonehams, the Antonious, the Birds and the Fasayes are tasked with making comfort food for 10 and breakfast with a twist. Judges Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks will decide which three of them progress to the next round and which one is eliminated

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary tour of the country, laced with history, literature and stunning photography. Driving a clapped-out old VW camper van around the Galicia region on the Atlantic coast, Rick discovers places off the beaten track as he samples classic dishes of rural Spain, a country he believes has been underrated in cookery circles until quite recently

programme.title: Lover Come Back (1961)
programme.desc: Advertising executive Carol Templeton is determined to outdo her competitor Jerry Webster at every opportunity. When an important campaign comes up, she tries to beat him to it and clinch the deal, whatever the price. Unfortunately for her, she fails to realise the whole thing is a set-up devised by her hated rival. Romantic comedy, starring Doris Day, Rock Hudson, Tony Randall, Edie Adams and Jack Oakie

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the third and final stage of the women's race, featuring a 92km circuit that starts and finishes at The Mall in central London. Lorena Wiebes of the Netherlands dominated last year's race, winning every stage

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents an edition from Bristol Cathedral. Natasha Raskin Sharp notices a painting of an apothecary on a piece of tin, and James Lewis looks at a valuable royal ring

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the eastward course of the river South Esk from its source in the hills above Glen Clova to the Montrose Basin, and on to the sea. Along the way he searches for Scotland's rarest plant, goes electro-fishing to discover more about the ecology and general health of the whole river system, and rides a motorbike to the ancestral home of Harley-Davidson

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Stanley heads to Rome and meets up with old friend Claudia della Frattina, heading to a restaurant to order rigatoni all'amatriciana, one of the famous four Roman pastas. He also samples carbonara in the working-class neighbourhood of San Lorenzo and tries a selection of cheeses and sausages sourced from the sheep and pigs bred in the region.

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America
programme.desc: On the fourth leg of his journey through the continent, Simon travels through three of the world's most extreme environments as he takes in the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazil's Pantanal wetland region and Paraguay's Chaco Forest. In Bolivia, he meets a family making a living carving salt from the vast white expanse of the Uyuni flats, while in Brazil he has a close encounter with South America's apex predator, the jaguar. In Paraguay, Simon visits a Mennonites school, where traditionally clothed children are drilled in Bible texts and there are no smartphones to be seen

programme.title: Barry Humphries at the BBC
programme.desc: Alex Jones looks back at the highlights of the comedian and actor's career on a selection of BBC shows, sharing her own memories alongside some of Barry's funniest, rudest and most revealing moments from over the decades. It's a collection that demonstrates exactly why his alter egos of Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson were loved by comedy fans across the world, while also highlighting how it was Barry who was really one of a kind

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob
programme.desc: Howard Jacobson examines the impact of Australians Robert Hughes, Clive James, Barry Humphries and Germaine Greer on western culture. In the first of two parts, the author uncovers the backgrounds of the four, exploring the notion that their desire for knowledge was borne from living in a place they believed to be devoid of culture, and uncovering their time spent together as part of Sydney's 'Push' movement

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob
programme.desc: Part two of two. Howard Jacobson continues to chart the rise of Germaine Greer, Clive James, Barry Humphries and Robert Hughes, exploring how they became influential figures not just at home in Australia, but also around the world. He looks at their achievements as young adults, and how they found fame as a journalist, memoirist, comic performer and art critic respectively

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Almost Australian
programme.desc: On the final leg of her journey, the actress visits Gulf of Carpentaria to see where the wealth of the country comes from. At the McArthur River Mine, she is taken aback by the enormity and scale of this operation. Miriam arrives in suburban Brisbane where she meets one of the wealthiest couples in Australia and visits their wildlife research centre, where they are working to save the koala from extinction. After eight weeks and 10,000kms, Miriam's final stop is Burleigh Heads on the Gold Coast, where she accompanies a family taking part in 'Nippers', a surf education program for young Australians

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce is in Kent for the latest topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Gravesend to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to travel by train to more places around the British Isles, beginning by heading to the self-governing Isle of Man - a paradise for rail lovers. His first stop on the Manx Electric Railway is the capital of Douglas, where he reveals the island's parliament the Tynwald is older than Westminster, before the Isle of Man Steam Railway takes him down the east coast to Castletown, from where he heads to the Norse Castle Rusheword

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts as two teams of antiques enthusiasts battle it out in Doune, Perthshire, under the guidance of experts Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian. Natasha also meets leading tartan historian Peter MacDonald to learn about the origins of the iconic patterned cloth

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman go in search of tips and treats at the York Food Festival, including homemade hummus and the many surprising varieties of the English apple. Onkar Singh Purewal is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat, Ryan Hand gets to grips with Japanese cuisine, and chef Julie Lin reveals some affordable seafood

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale makes over two spaces on the Isle of Mull, turning a Tobermory castle turret room into a B&B destination and revamping a guest bedroom at the Rubha nan Gall lighthouse. Contending with complicated logistics and bad weather, Banjo and the team must go above and beyond to complete two makeovers in these stunning locations

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef's tour reaches the south coast of England, where he discovers how the forests of Hampshire are home to one of Britain's most prized culinary ingredients, the truffle, and why tomatoes grown on the Isle of Wight are rivalling those from Italy. Along the way, he prepares forest truffle chicken and stuffed tomatoes

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin visit Walney Island off the west coast of England, Arit Anderson meets a community of gardeners who have been prescribed gardening to help mental and physical illness, and Mary Berry shows us how to cook a perfect summer pudding

programme.title: Big Cats About the House
programme.desc: Giles Clark is feeling overwhelmed by the enormity of the task he has taken on with the Big Cat Sanctuary in Kent. He is paying close attention to the health of Maya the jaguar, who is now seven weeks old, in particular her wavering eyesight and back legs that still seem a little wobbly. Giles also visits Costa Rica to help jaguars in the wild

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: A family of five works in a corner shop to reveal how such businesses have changed over the course of the past 100 years, aided by presenter Sara Cox and social historian Polly Russell. The first episode covers shops from the Victorian era to the First World War. The family must learn to bake their own counter goods, measure loose products like tea, flour and sugar by hand, and make deliveries with a horse and cart. They also receive a visit from Kelly Holmes, who puts them through an Edwardian workout and discover the impact of food shortages on corner shops as the war drew on

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Will Axon and Christina Trevanion assess items at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, a 17th-century Palladian house owned by the Marquess of Hertford. The pair unearth treasures to take off to auction including a Polynesian paddle and an 18th-century drinking glass. Presenter Paul Martin also explores the work of famous sculptor and wood carver Grinling Gibbons

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo joins the hunt for dark matter in the deepest mine in Britain in Boulby, North Yorkshire, then visits Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge, which offers high views over the Tees estuary and the Cleveland Hills. At Saltholme, Michael joins the RSPB in a hide to observe a visiting bird of prey

programme.title: Digging for Britain: The Greatest Discoveries
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts re-examines key archaeological sites of prehistoric Britain, from the arrival of the earliest humans to mysterious ceremonies at Stonehenge

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan present from their new base at RSPB Arne in Dorset, where nest cameras are rigged and ready to capture all the drama of the season. Iolo Williams is out and about explores the neighbouring Purbeck Heaths national nature reserve, while Gillian Burke sets off to explore Snowdonia National Park

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as two teams battle it out in the grand final of the student quiz, endeavouring to succeed last year's winners Imperial College London and become the 52nd champions, carrying off the trophy designed by Manchester sculptor Adrian Moakes

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at the growth of paramilitary organisations in the early 1970s, with killings, explosions, intimidation and street disorder becoming widespread - with devastating and often lasting effects. Coercive control, intimidation, beatings and executions were part of how these groups operated in their different communities, a world in which people could be 'disappeared'', never to be found for decades afterwards

programme.title: Goodfellas (1990)
programme.desc: An Irish-Italian boy from a poor neighbourhood grows up idolising the glamorous lifestyle of the Mafia. Taken under the wing of a mobster, he rises quickly in the world of organised crime. But he soon has to face the realities of murder and treachery, while his involvement in drug deals puts him at risk from both sides of the law. Martin Scorsese's crime drama, starring Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro and an Oscar-winning Joe Pesci

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sammi Kinghorn presents the first of three visits to a hill farm in Cumbria, where 16-year-old shepherd Katie recruits her for springtime chores and assisting with a surprise birth. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at the Turkish president's response to an attempted military coup in 2016, using emergency powers to crack down even harder on dissent and taking control of the armed forces and judiciary

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey at Liverpool's historic waterfront, where he visits the International Slavery Museum at Royal Albert Dock, before heading underground to discover one of the most important and secret rooms of the Second World War, the Royal Navy's Western Approaches Headquarters. His next stop is Crosby on the Merseyside coastline in Sefton, before making his way north to Blackpool, the last stop on this leg of his journey

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are in Marlborough to design a courtyard garden for Nancy and Simon that reminds them of Beverly Hills - where they used to live

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at some of the UK's most beautiful and historic homes, and people who are saving the past for all of us. This episode features Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, an Elizabethan masterpiece, commissioned by the formidable Bess of Hardwick in the late 1500s

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans makes an appeal on behalf of Melanoma Focus, a charity supporting patients and carers, as well as funding specialist skin cancer research across the UK

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces the week's highlights, including a meeting of last year's Grand Finalists as Leeds Rhinos host St Helens. Plus, the best moments of Hull Kingston Rovers v Wigan Warriors, Leigh Leopards v Warrington Wolves, Huddersfield Giants v Castleford Tigers, Salford Red Devils v Hull FC and Catalans Dragons v Wakefield Trinity

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: In the West Country, the chef finds out why milk produced in Devon is so creamy and visits a small corner of Cornwall that has started exporting tea to China. During his journey, he cooks up an exotic tea-smoked duck and clotted-cream summer pudding

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: John Craven chooses the best beaches in Britain and Nadiya Hussain shows how to make the perfect dish for a summer party - rice and edamame bean salad. Paul Martin hires a fruit tree - the perfect way to enjoy a summer fruit harvest

programme.title: Big Cats About the House
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Giles Clark at his sanctuary for big cats in Kent. Maya the jaguar is 10 weeks old and is starting to push the family to their limits as she wreaks havoc in the house, destroying the bookshelf, getting into the fridge and ripping up the sofa. However, after an appearance on breakfast TV with Giles, she becomes a big-cat ambassador. Giles also takes in a five-month-old cheetah called Willow, who is recovering from an incident where she broke her paw, and travels to Kenya to help lions in need

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: The Arderns get a taste of running a store in the 1920s, '30s and '40s, considered the golden age of the corner shop due to the plentiful availability of packaged food. However, rationing quickly has a devastating impact on both the shop and the family's day-to-day lives, with carrot lollies and mutton bacon proving less than enticing meals. The Arderns learn how to make ice cream by hand and blend tea, as well as taking delivery of a vintage fruit machine. They also find themselves at the centre of a community party recreating the VE Day celebrations

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Norwich Cathedral, once home to Benedictine monks. Experts Thomas Plant and David Fletcher pick out some items to take to auction. Among them are an old astronomical map and a watercolour by a local artist. Paul also explores the history of the nearby Broads

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared each Friday

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Whitby, where he explores the port's shipbuilding and seafaring heritage, to Robin Hood's Bay, a former smuggling haven

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Scotland and northern England, Alice Roberts investigates an Ice Age camp, a mysterious medieval skeleton and the earliest evidence of salt making in Britain

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan present further reports from RSPB Arne in Dorset, where Chris gets into the finer detail of some of the nests on site. Michaela heads out in search of all six of Britain's native reptile species, Iolo Williams uncovers some surprising revelations about British flora and Gillian Burke goes in search of Snowdonia's bats

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: West Midlands Police work to identify who is responsible for a major fire that has burned a factory in Birmingham to the ground. Fire investigator Luke Beckett is deployed to open the case before vital evidence is destroyed by the blaze, but after searching the wreckage, the cause is still a mystery. With no natural sources of ignition, Luke concludes the fire was started deliberately and, in a stroke of luck, the factory's CCTV room is left intact after the fire

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: After breaking up, Ashley and Gordon must find a new home for Colin the dog so they can go their separate ways. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Denmark (2019)
programme.desc: Herb, a 34-year-old Welshman with a knack for fixing things, can't get a proper job and has an estranged son. He's also lost his welfare, and has a neighbour who plays incessant music. After discovering Danish convicts live a luxurious life he could only dream of, Herb decides to get arrested overseas and hopes to be sent to a Danish prison. However, after meeting Mathilda, a local barmaid, and a lovable stray dog who won't leave his side, Herb realises prison may not be his only chance to get the life he hoped for. Comedy drama, starring Rafe Spall, Simone Lykke and Thomas Gabrielsson

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The bomber reveals how he came to plant the explosives on the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, and the measures he took to escape New Zealand after the attack. He and another suspect reveal the origins of the mission - the French government convincing them that the KGB had infiltrated Greenpeace

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining 14 chefs kick off Knockout Week by being split into two groups. The first group of seven cook a dish that they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or would feature in their cookbook. Guest judge Anna Haugh joins John Torode to decide which five will go on to cook at a restaurant and which two will be going home. The remaining five head to Kings Cross in London to work at Decimo under chef Peter Sanchez-Iglesias. During a busy lunch service, the five amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Gilbert and Sullivan's Yeomen of the Guard
programme.desc: English National Opera's new production of the much-loved Gilbert & Sullivan classic, a fast-paced caper set in the Tower of London, with the action shifted to the 1950s, the time of the Queen's coronation. Colonel Fairfax is under sentence of death. Can his old friend, the Beefeater Sergeant Merryl, save him? And what of Merryl's daughter Phoebe, who has fallen hopelessly in love with the colonel? Anthony Gregory and Neal Davies lead the cast, with the Orchestra & Chorus of ENO conducted by Chris Hopkins

programme.title: Cilla in Scandinavia
programme.desc: Cilla Black hosts a 1971 show specially recorded in Stockholm on Midsummer's Day and on film locations in Norway, Sweden and Finland. Guests include Ringo Starr, Sven-Bertil Taube, Basil Brush, Hannu Mikkola and Marvin, Welch & Farrar

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Archive performances by Cilla Black, who sings Step Inside Love, For Once in My Life and Liverpool Lullaby. She also duets with Georrgie Fame and Dusty Springfield, and there's a comedy sketch from Graeme Garden, Tim Brooke-Taylor and Graham Chapman

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of the city's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: Film-maker Chris Terrill captures an intimate and personal portrait of life on board ultra-modern super aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth, as its crew learns the intricacies of a warship that will change the way Britain goes to war. In this first instalment, early 2016 sees sailors begin to arrive in Rosyth dockyard in Scotland where the ship is still in construction, but nearing completion. Captain Jerry Kyd and his 700 sailors are assembling to take the prototype warship to sea for the first time. These trials herald what should be 50 years of service

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of the city's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. Paul hears from those who remember the opening ceremony, before pulling on his climbing gear to attempt the limestone cliff face of Malham Cove. He also visits a sheep sale in Wensleydale and enjoys a pint in Britain's highest pub

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word

programme.title: Close to Vermeer
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. The documentary follows curators, conservators, collectors and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary using archive performance footage and interviews to explore the life of Miriam Makeba, the Johannesburg-born singer and civil rights activist who was forced into exile in 1960 for opposing the apartheid regime. Miriam became one of the first South African musicians to make a name for herself on the international scene, and she used her music to deliver messages against racism and poverty

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc: Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Reau, Alfie, Charlie, Ollie, Otis, River and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag is a night light, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that could be used as part of a bedtime routine. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate bedtime objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The baby lullaby Little One Time For Bed features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show what theyve been doing at bedtime too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

But when he tries to talk through his plan and warm-up, his friends play with their equipment and have fun doing their own exercises. programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Lola, Sullivan, Pip, Theo, Oakley and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Nigel has got a fluffy pom pom inside his bag. All the parents and babies have different toys or objects that feel fluffy too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate fluffy toy or object inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, to explore with their baby. Some viewers at home show what fluffy items theyve been playing with too. The traditional nursery rhyme Mary Had a Little Lamb features, as does a story about Baby Bear exploring different textures. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

Archaeologist Dr Erin Lloyd Jones finds out what the Romans did for Wales and Matthew Bassett explores decorative Oriental-inspired tinware once made in the town

Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the concluding round of Premier League fixtures, as the final standings were confirmed. programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. programme.title: Family Footsteps
programme.desc: The Quail Walkers' final step into their Ulster-Scots history starts in Toronto, Canada, where Gavin Andrews finally reveals to Desmond and Caroline the identity of a famous ancestor. He was at the centre of a Victorian maritime mystery and his story is the stuff of legend. The Quail boys have learnt about him at school but had no idea there was a family connection. Dad Phil, Noah and Fionn travel to London to test their sea legs while Caroline and Desmond head to Ottawa to meet the experts working to unravel the mystery surrounding their ancestor who went missing in the arctic archipelago

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. In order to avoid ruining his super cool, geeky greasy hairdo, Mo wants to avoid taking the shower Selina is imposing on him before he can go to the arcade for a livestream with the city's best gamers. He asks the Scepter for the ability to smell good without washing. He's now giving off this delicious magnolia scent, but he's also starting to sweat shower gel profusely! Mo has to think fast and fix his problem before Maya sees what he's doing!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo and Lenny are finally going to watch the movie they've been waiting for. But as they arrive at the cashier to buy their tickets, they are turned away because they are too young and can only come in with an adult. Impatient and outraged, Mo decides to ask for the power to age so he can accompany Lenny to see the movie. But with half-power, neither Mo, nor Sam age: everyone around them gets younger- mentally! They act like immature kids that are impossible to handle.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Enfield, north London, Alan Titchmarsh and his team transform a garden for Yvonne, a woman who has devoted her life to combatting knife crime after the death of her son who was tragically murdered when he was just 17-years-old. Alan's design is all about the garden becoming a healing space, where Yvonne can remember her son, and where the family can come together again. Elsewhere, Katie Rushworth learns just how healing nature can be at the Cascades Gardens in Derbyshire.

programme.desc: A cunning English nobleman puts his talent for disguise to good use by rescuing aristocrats from execution during the French Revolution. Comedy spoof of the Scarlet Pimpernel story, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims, Jim Dale and Charles Hawtrey

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan as the genteel sleuth. A woman experiences an unsettling vision after moving into the home of her dreams - and it transpires she lived in the house as a child. Miss Marple investigates the history of the property and discovers it was connected with a baffling disappearance years before - which has never been solved. With Dawn French, Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster teams up with a dashing man to investigate a series of poison-pen letters in the sleepy village of Lymstock. Two of the missives have led to the deaths of Mona Symmington, the wife of Lymstock solicitor Richard, and Agnes Woddell, the parlour maid at the Symmingtons' house. However, Miss Marple suspects there is more to these deaths than meets the eye. Murder mystery with an all-star cast, featuring Geraldine McEwan, James D'Arcy, Emilia Fox, Imogen Stubbs, Ken Russell, Harry Enfield and Kelly Brook

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: An Audience with Ronnie Corbett
programme.desc: The comedian entertains his peers, fans, friends and family with jokes and ramblings in a show recorded in 1997. Celebrity audience members include Donald Sinden, Martin Jarvis, Gorden Kaye, Lynda Bellingham, Norman Bowler, Kevin Lloyd and Desmond Llewelyn. Ronnie Barker also joins the host on stage to re-create some of the magic of the Two Ronnies

programme.title: An Audience with Jimmy Tarbuck
programme.desc: The Liverpudlian comic performs before a host of showbiz celebrities including Cilla Black, Bruce Forsyth, Billy Connolly, Michael Parkinson, Harry Secombe and Henry Cooper. Jimmy will be fielding questions from the audience, and the event concludes with a special jam session featuring Hank Marvin, Rick Wakeman, Kenny Jones, Justin Hayward and John Lodge

programme.title: The Booze Cruise (2003)
programme.desc: Five men set off on a shopping trip to a French hypermarket, determined to stock up on cheap champagne for a wedding, but a succession of disasters turns the journey into a nightmare. To make matters worse, cantankerous fellow traveller Maurice drives the Channel-hopping adventurers up the wall with his constant moaning, and the wives back home take full advantage of their husbands' absence. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Pearson, Brian Murphy and Mark Benton

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera suspects St John the vet is her grandson Nelson's father. Irene has her hands full looking after her pregnant daughter Lesley, grandchild Cheryl Marie and Lesley's impossible boyfriend Brian

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera discovers St John is wealthy and moves in with her daughter, while Irene returns home to supervise catering for the wedding, where the friends battle for Karen's bouquet. Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Scandal threatens to engulf Eaton Place as news spreads that James, already heavily in debt, has made one of the Bellamys' servants pregnant. Period drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh and David Langton

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Meanwhile, new recruit Sgt Rob Waddington arrives on the scene - putting Janet's nose out of joint as she is demoted back down to constable. Emmerdale star Danny Miller (Aaron Livesy) joins the cast

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The members of an Oxford old boys' cricket team gather for their annual match, unaware that death is waiting at the crease to bowl one of them out for good. Morse sets out to find the culprit - helped as ever by the faithful Lewis, who demonstrates unexpected skill on the pitch. John Thaw, Kevin Whately and Sharon Maughan star in an episode scripted by Oscar-winning director Anthony Minghella

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan offers to redecorate Arthur and Olive's bedroom, taking the distinctive green and yellow paint from the depot. However, once the paint is applied, it becomes clear there is a problem. Reg Varney stars

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Siobhan struggles to cope with her guilt. A disheartened Terry strives to come to terms with his stroke, and Gloria digs for dirt on Steph

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph joins forces with a local reporter to expose Gloria's affair in a sensational kiss-and-sell. Paul wants to try for another baby, and Terry's behaviour shocks Bob

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken and Deirdre's daughter Tracy returns home after leaving her husband Robert, while Richard turns his attentions to Emily

programme.title: On the Buses

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are assigned by Blakey to take a class of rowdy schoolchildren on their annual outing. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant

programme.title: Bugsy Malone (1976)
programme.desc: Alan Parker's slapstick musical comedy, featuring a cast composed entirely of children and following a war between rival gangsters in 1920s New York - fought with custard pies and cream-firing Tommy guns. When a slick mobster acquires devastating new weapons, his arch rival enlists the aid of a small-time chancer to steal them. Starring Scott Baio, Florrie Dugger and John Cassisi, with Jodie Foster in an early appearance

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike and Jackie suffer a terrifying ordeal at the hands of a stalker out for revenge, and David holds the fort while Greengrass and Bernie help to arrange a funeral with a difference. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A local church suffers a series of thefts and the finger of suspicion seems to point to the vicarage, of all places. Meanwhile, Greengrass's hopes of winning a dog show take a knock when his pedigree contestant goes missing. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gloria sets up surgery in the village hall, unaware that news of her dalliance has hit the tabloids. Frances is offended by Siobhan's attitude toward the miscarriage

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gloria makes a last-ditch attempt to save her floundering marriage, Siobhan's lies catch up with her as Paul uncovers his wife's treachery, and Charity begs a favour of Marlon

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey is stunned by a confession from Richard, who almost admits he tried to kill her. Elsewhere, Peter and Shelley do not react kindly to the news that Ciaran is here to stay

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre makes a shocking discovery about Tracy, Sarah has a tense encounter with Ade and the campaign to expose Richard as a murderer gathers momentum

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A farmer's murder and the crash landing of an enemy plane lead Foyle to investigate the activities of a group of land girls, and the detective begins to suspect the captured German airmen have something to hide. Stella Gonet and James Wilby guest star in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A former MP's lascivious past catches up with him just as he is planning a comfortable retirement, and Greengrass makes his presence felt at the village bonfire party as only he knows how. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, William Russell and Joanna David

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Ventress's old commando unit turns up - but the veterans have an old score to settle and a reporter causes emotions to boil over. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers her ex-partner is the defending barrister for Georgios Stelikos, a man on trial for rape and murder, and she is horrified when the accused escapes conviction. When Stelikos is later found dead, the prime suspect is Hannah Conway, who made public death threats against him after giving evidence for the prosecution in court. Meanwhile, Janet tries to support her colleague following devastating news. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Inspector Morse

programme.desc: Stan and Jack tease Blakey about the obvious attention he is receiving from the canteen girl

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Olive becomes convinced Arthur is having an affair with a conductress at the depot. Comedy, with Reg Varney, Anna Karen and Michael Robbins

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Caroline is opposed to working with Ed Lynch and is furious at what she sees as Danny's betrayal of Du Plessis, whom she plans to reinstall in his rightful place in the business with the help of a familiar face from the past. However, when a bush fire spirals out of control, there are devastating consequences for the entire family. African-set wildlife drama, starring Hayley Mills, Stephen Tompkinson and Deon Stewardson

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The family fears that Du Plessis is having a nervous breakdown when he starts to believe he is being haunted by the ghost of Peeters - and the visions drive him to make a confession to Caroline. Danny and Ed come to a rash decision during an animal rescue, endangering everything they have been working toward. African-set wildlife drama, starring Deon Stewardson, Hayley Mills, Stephen Tompkinson and Robert Bathurst

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A former MP's lascivious past catches up with him just as he is planning a comfortable retirement, and Greengrass makes his presence felt at the village bonfire party as only he knows how. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, William Russell and Joanna David

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Ventress's old commando unit turns up - but the veterans have an old score to settle and a reporter causes emotions to boil over. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul moves back home, refusing to have anything to do with Siobhan as he tries to make sense of her treacherous actions. Steph pushes Shelly too far

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: As Charity awaits her fate, a shock revelation leaves the court with no choice but to grant her bail. Gloria gives up on her marriage, leaving the way clear for another

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve tries to borrow money from the bank to save the business. Ken can't understand why Deirdre is so against Tracy seeing Dev. Roy finally arrives back from Paxos.

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Craddock's mother fancies herself as a bit of a Miss Marple figure following a mysterious murder in the village, but her well-meaning interference drives everyone mad. Elsewhere, Greengrass has a stroke of luck on the horses, and David gets more than he bargained for at the vet's. Rural drama, with Philip Franks and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The villagers close ranks when travellers pass through Aidensfield, and the already tense atmosphere becomes even more volatile when a bank robber goes on the run. Meanwhile, Greengrass is more concerned with making a killing on a pony and trap race - but he may not be able to outwit the Aidensfield police this time. David Essex guest stars, alongside Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley and Julie Graham

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet moves a step closer to tracking down Veronica's killer while investigating a recent murder that bears similarities to the cold case. Rachel finds out about an affair Nick once had with a juror in the middle of a trial - a revelation that could end his career. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Rupert Graves

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel has a lucky escape while walking home when she narrowly avoids being hit by a car. Shaken, she starts pursuing the driver, who has fled on foot, and the next day she suspects the incident was an attempted murder - and that Nick may be involved. As she tries to deal with the revelation, Janet is left to take charge of the latest case - the gang shooting of a teenager whose friend is a key witness. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.desc: Deirdre makes a shocking discovery about Tracy, Sarah has a tense encounter with Ade and the campaign to expose Richard as a murderer gathers momentum

However, when a bush fire spirals out of control, there are devastating consequences for the entire family. African-set wildlife drama, starring Hayley Mills, Stephen Tompkinson and Deon Stewardson

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The family fears that Du Plessis is having a nervous breakdown when he starts to believe he is being haunted by the ghost of Peeters - and the visions drive him to make a confession to Caroline. African-set wildlife drama, starring Deon Stewardson, Hayley Mills, Stephen Tompkinson and Robert Bathurst

programme.desc: A former MP's lascivious past catches up with him just as he is planning a comfortable retirement, and Greengrass makes his presence felt at the village bonfire party as only he knows how. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, William Russell and Joanna David

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Ventress's old commando unit turns up - but the veterans have an old score to settle and a reporter causes emotions to boil over. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Craddock's mother fancies herself as a bit of a Miss Marple figure following a mysterious murder in the village, but her well-meaning interference drives everyone mad. programme.title: Heartbeat

Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley and Julie Graham

In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp.
