programme.desc: Scott is exhausted and unable to sleep, so Jack offers him some parenting advice. Elsewhere, Imran makes Juliet a promise, and Ethan is in Sienna's bad books

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Greatest Auction
programme.desc: AJ Odudu hosts as buyers bid for the neon sign of a Soho sex shop and a piece of the wedding cake of William and Catherine, the Prince and Princess of Wales. Plus, one of only five remaining copies of Henry Beck's redesign of the London Tube map dating back to the 1930s

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc: Kevin and Natasha meet couple Jane and Richard who are building houses three doors down from each other in hopes of providing a new life for the five children they have between them. But where Jane's plan involves a beautifully crafted home with a high-end kitchen, Richard is planning on building a minimal and sleek property with some special architectural moments

programme.title: Gender Wars
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on polarising conversations surrounding the meaning of sex and gender, featuring contributions from people at the heart of the dialogue. They include philosopher and writer Kathleen Stock, who left her university job after protests against her views on gender self- identification, and Professor Stephen Whittle, who has been actively involved in the campaign for transgender rights for 50 years

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A night out with friends ends badly when a car crashes into two vehicles, with police, firefighters and paramedics called to the scene. In Birmingham, a young woman is found lying collapsed and unconscious in the street and needs medical help. Paramedics also attend to the needs of an apparently homeless person having difficulty walking in the city centre. Plus, a family night playing board games ends with a man lying unconscious on the kitchen floor

programme.title: Porn King: The Rise & Fall of Ron Jeremy
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary revealing how the porn star's alleged crimes were eventually brought to light. Having made his name as a porn star, Ron Jeremy now crossed over into the mainstream, making Hollywood friends, becoming a reality star and even selling his own range of rum. But when he is accused of molesting a 15-year-old girl, as well as a church-going, lifelong friend, police finally investigate

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc: A visit to the billionaires Bahamian retreat of Harbour Island and the pared-back luxury of 50,000-a-week King's View. Plus, the 18,000-a-night royal suite at the ultra-luxurious Burgenstock Hotel and Alpine Spa on Lake Lucerne, Switzerland, and the 8,500-a-night hotel Le Grand Controle on the grounds of the Palace of Versailles. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Lela's, a Pomona, California, restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Car salesman Paul and his partner Sara host first in Sheffield, but their evening is dogged by bickering. Next, glamorous newlyweds Russell and Shane plan an evening of romance, but their loved-up theme falls on deaf ears and their American menu raises a few eyebrows. Finally, kooky Janine and Neil's evening is full of revelations, but Russell and Shane are convinced they have it in the bag

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of small builds, meeting people taking tiny, unpromising spaces and creating places to live, work and play. In the first episode of a new series, George meets a couple who are creating a disappearing bathroom and a man squeezing a camper into a Reliant Robin. He also discovers Chile's stunning architecture, and plans his hardest-ever build, an observatory

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows highlighting the way working from home is changing the way many people live. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?

programme.title: Britain's Scenic Railways

Plus, the hero who rescued the crumbling Ribblehead Viaduct. Narrated by Bill Paterson

programme.title: The Blackouts of '74: When Britain Went Dark
programme.desc: Archive footage and celebrity recollections reveal how 50 years ago during an energy crisis the government imposed a three-day working week for factories, shops and business, and UK-wide household blackouts. Contributors including Billy Brag, Michael Heseltine, Trevor McDonald, Pete Waterman, Diane Jordan and Fern Britton reflect on their own experiences of the blackouts back in 1974

programme.title: Murder on the Doorstep: Who Killed Alistair Wilson?
programme.desc: The killing of Alistair Wilson has baffled detectives for almost 20 years. Just after 7pm on 28 November 2004, the young Scottish banker and father was executed on his own doorstep - shot three times at point blank range in a seemingly motiveless assassination. Despite one of the biggest manhunts ever launched in Scotland by the police, Alistair Wilson's murder remains unsolved. This documentary retraces every step of the case, from the killer's arrival at the Wilson house on a dark November evening, right through to the present police investigation

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: At West Orchards in Coventry, security guard Lewis receives a call from a store that needs urgent assistance. A member of staff is claiming to have been assaulted and all available guards are scrambled to assist. The suspect is apprehended and taken to the holding room where his offences soon stack up. Meanwhile in London's West End, a call comes in from a retailer who has detained a suspected shoplifter

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Tony Robinson's History of Britain
programme.desc: The actor explores the lives of people from the Victorian era, including a 13-year-old girl who worked 14-hour shifts in a Bryant & May factory in London's East End, a woman who worked down a mine at Knowles Pitt near Bolton and a navvy who blasted tons of rock from the Highlands to help construct an ambitious water channel. Tony also hears the story of one of the first employees of Marks & Spencer.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Pharmacist Rozina has to call for advice from Dr Wyne when one of her elderly patients looks like he might have skin cancer, while Dr Ahmed sees a regular patient who has been struggling with stomach aches and vomiting. Dr Wyne has an appointment with Sana, who comes in to talk about her repeat prescription of the pill, and the GP realises there might be complications with the number of other medications she is taking

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Tris Payne visit Southampton's prestigious marina development Ocean Village, where a couple's home needs sprucing up to attract potential buyers after being on the market for three months

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A cold snap knocks out the power at the fire station, while Norman tries to clean a scarf he used to dress a snowman

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: The engine visits Australia and decides to become an outback tour guide, with disastrous consequences

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003)
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness (2013)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and the crew of the starship Enterprise are sent on a clandestine mission into enemy territory to track down the rogue Starfleet agent behind a terrorist attack on Earth. However, the assignment brings to light a hidden threat from within their own organisation. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Arrival (2016)
programme.desc: The world is thrown into uproar when 12 alien spaceships arrive at locations around the globe. As tensions rise between nations and fear of the arrivals grows, a recently bereaved linguist is recruited by the US army to find a way to communicate with the aliens and discover why they have come. Sci-fi drama, starring Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Alien: Covenant (2017)
programme.desc: A crew of colonists sent to populate an alien planet have their mission diverted by a mysterious signal. After landing on a nearby world, they discover what became of the ill-fated Prometheus mission. Ridley Scott's sci-fi thriller, starring Katherine Waterston, Michael Fassbender and Danny McBride

programme.title: Shallow Grave (1994)
programme.desc: Three flat-sharing friends rent out their spare room to an enigmatic stranger, who promptly dies of an overdose, leaving behind a suitcase crammed full of cash. They plot to dispose of the body and keep the money - but as a curious detective comes looking for the dead man, the flatmates turn on one another. Danny Boyle's thriller, starring Ewan McGregor, Christopher Eccleston and Kerry Fox

programme.title: Sign2Win
programme.desc: Three teams' BSL language and deaf cultural knowledge are put to the test to see who will win 1,000

programme.title: Sister Act (1992)
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993)
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Men in Black 3 Interview Special
programme.desc: Will Smith discusses returning to the role of Agent J for the third film in the sci-fi comedy series, and director Barry Sonnenfeld speaks about his role behind the camera on the three movies. Newcomer Josh Brolin shares his thoughts on filling Tommy Lee Jones' shoes as a younger version of veteran alien-catcher Agent K

programme.title: The Great Escape (1963)
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Men in Black (1997)
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: The Favourite Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Emma Stone, Olivia Colman and Rachel Weisz and director Yorgos Lanthimos talk about making the period comedy drama, set in the early 18th century in the court of Queen Anne

programme.title: Let Him Go (2020)
programme.desc: Retired sheriff George Blackledge and his horse trainer wife Margaret live on a ranch in 1960s Montana, with their son James, his wife Lorna and their son Jimmy. A freak riding accident takes James' life, and the Blackledges watch helplessly as Lorna eventually marries Donnie, who communicates with his fists. Without warning, Donnie spirits Lorna and three-year-old Jimmy away to his family home in North Dakota. Crime drama, starring Kevin Costner, Diane Lane and Kayli Carter

programme.title: The Long Good Friday (1980)
programme.desc: A ruthless London crime lord tries to extend his dockland empire by exploring business opportunities in America. When his organisation is the target of a series of bombings, he discovers a mysterious syndicate is trying to muscle in on his territory, and resorts to increasingly brutal methods to expose the culprits. Gritty thriller, starring Bob Hoskins, Helen Mirren, Dave King and Bryan Marshall, with Pierce Brosnan and Casualty's Derek Thompson in supporting roles

programme.title: Mean Machine (2001)
programme.desc: A disgraced soccer star jailed for assaulting two policemen is persuaded by the prison authorities to form a football team of inmates to take on the guards. Unfortunately, whipping his fellow prisoners into shape proves a tricky proposition. Comedy drama, starring Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham, David Hemmings and Jason Flemyng

programme.title: Tomahawk (1951)
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jim Bridger doesn't approve when a gold rush leads the US army to build a fort on land occupied by the Sioux. The situation goes from bad to worse when a sadistic officer launches an unprovoked attack, prompting a vengeful tribe to go on the offensive and leaving Bridger the only one who can save the soldiers at the fort from certain death. Western, starring Van Heflin, Yvonne de Carlo and Alex Nicol, and featuring an early appearance by Rock Hudson

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes (1955)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Men in Black II (2002)
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: The Favourite (2018)
programme.desc: In early 18th-century England, a sickly Queen Anne occupies the throne while her close friend, Lady Sarah, governs the country. When a new servant, Abigail, arrives, Sarah is won over by her charm. Yorgos Lanthimos's multi Bafta-winning black comedy starring an Oscar-winning Olivia Colman, with Emma Stone and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: The Girl in the Spider's Web (2018)
programme.desc: Swedish hacker Lisbeth Salander is hired by computer genius Frans Balder to retrieve Firefall, a programme capable of accessing the world's nuclear codes that he developed for the National Security Agency. Though Salander manages to find Firefall, it's not long before she's fighting for her life against mercenaries. Thriller, starring Claire Foy and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein (2015)
programme.desc: A sideshow performer is taken in by a scientist, who seeks his help in performing experiments to create life, and hopefully uncover the secrets of immortality. The plan goes dangerously out of control, and it falls to the devoted assistant to save his master from his dark obsessions and his monstrous creation. Gothic horror, starring James McAvoy and Daniel Radcliffe

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Things get violent outside the youth centre when DeMarcus tries to protect Vicky, while Felix clashes with Warren, and Dillon makes a brave confession to his family

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Amusing internet videos, featuring a variety of boats, animals surfing, and a dating agency for sea captains, while there is dancing from across the world

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes fun of Leonard's habit of collecting sci-fi memorabilia, so he decides to give it up - but his friends object and do everything possible to persuade him not to change his ways. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's friends all fall for his sexy twin sister, who is paying him a visit, but he declares he will have the final say on who can date her - an announcement that particularly dismays Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Following the break-up of Penny's relationship, Leonard finally summons up the courage to ask her out. When she accepts, they both turn to Sheldon for advice on how to handle the forthcoming date. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid (1994)
programme.desc: Wise karate mentor Mr Miyagi meets the orphaned teenage grand-daughter of a soldier who once saved his life. As well as guiding her through the trials of high school and her first romance, he takes her to a Zen monastery to hone her martial arts skills. Adventure sequel, starring Pat Morita, Hilary Swank, Michael Ironside and Constance Towers

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is dejected to see Penny with another man and decides to cut his losses by going back to fellow scientist Leslie Winkle - a move that upsets Sheldon. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Sara Gilbert

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian. As her obsession intensifies, she begins to neglect her friends and seeks the company of the usually snide Sheldon, whom she continually pesters for advice. Starring Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Elated at being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj makes a pass at Penny and becomes very arrogant, making it hard for Leonard to maintain a positive perspective on his friend's new-found confidence. Guest starring Charlie Sheen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon seeks revenge on Howard when his colleague dresses up as him for Halloween. Leonard is shocked that Penny does not remember their first kiss

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is caught between a rock and a hard place when he is made responsible for distributing extra grant money. Bernadette turns the back garden playhouse into a hideaway to escape from her husband and children

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are devastated after learning from a Russian paper that Super Asymmetry has already been discovered and disproved. Bernadette wants to beat Howard in a video game

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon are still feeling down about their theory being disproven, until an old VHS tape from Sheldon's past inspires the couple not to give up

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes jealous when Amy gets attention in the media, Raj spots Anu talking to her ex-boyfriend, and Stuart is intimidated by the idea of moving in with Denise, all of which cause mayhem when Penny and Leonard organise a paintball game

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: Atomic Blonde (2017)
programme.desc: MI6 operative Lorraine Broughton is sent to Berlin before the fall of the wall to investigate the murder of a fellow spy and recover a missing list of double agents. The city is in a dangerously unstable state, and she finds herself targetted by multiple factions plotting to exploit the uncertain future for their own ruthless ends. Thriller, starring Charlize Theron, James McAvoy and John Goodman

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The X Factor, The Ganges with Sue Perkins, Your Song, Obsessive Compulsive Country House Cleaners, Strictly Come Dancing, Antiques Roadshow, Gunpowder and the News. First shown in October 2017

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including Strictly Come Dancing, Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railways, Louis Theroux: My Scientology Movie, Sheridan, Nigella: At My Table and the News. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes. From November 2017

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 21-year-old YouTuber Jay from London, who has no problem messaging women online but cannot make connections in real life, and 28-year-old Victoria from Liverpool, who is looking for her very own Xena, Warrior Princess. Will the back-to-basics approach of Naked Attraction help either of them find what they're looking for?

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Things get violent outside the youth centre when DeMarcus tries to protect Vicky, while Felix clashes with Warren, and Dillon makes a brave confession to his family

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Felix is hurt knowing that DeMarcus blames him for ending up in hospital, and is determined to make things right. Meanwhile, Scott has trouble on his hands

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word 'hon', a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denise's unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Tina tries to get into the Chrsitmas spirit by reviving traditions from when Malcolm and Marty were kids, while the Johnsons' present for Grover is stolen

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave's patience is tested when Gemma's sister suddenly shows up with plans for an extended stay

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is flattered when a graduate student takes a shine to him, but she thinks his social life is distracting him from his work and removes him from his limited circle of friends by forcing him to work on a troublesome scientific problem. Guest starring Riki Lindhome

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny's TV breaks down, so she heads to the boys' flat to watch her favourite shows. However, Sheldon tires of her presence and bans future visits, leading to an embarrassing form of retaliation. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family

Nathan Lane guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A visitor from Latvia causes Boyle and Peralta to begin investigating Nikolaj's family. Captain Holt and Santiago bring in famed forensic scientist Dr Yee to help close a difficult murder case for Diaz

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle brings Peralta into a case when a psychiatrist reports one of his patients missing, while Santiago believes she has accidentally received a package meant for Jeffords

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon upsets guest star Stephen Hawking when they play an online game of Words with Friends, until Howard advises him to let the scientist win. Elsewhere, Penny enrols in a college class, but decides to keep it a secret from Leonard. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mother's house

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicist's favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover actress Summer Glau is on their train while travelling to San Francisco. Desperate to discuss the Terminator TV series with her, the friends devise a number of plans to engage her in conversation. With Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil, Jay and Luke wage war against three generations of Thorpes, including Phil's arch- rival Gil. Mitch and Cam ask Claire to collect Lily from school - but forget to mention the outbreak of head lice - and Gloria chaperones a field trip, giving her cause to worry about Manny's lack of self-confidence

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is mightily annoyed after organising the school's most successful fundraiser, only for Spanish teacher Senor Kaplan to steal his thunder. Husband-to-be Mitchell, on the other hand, can't make up his mind about his old college pal Wendy, who is now his new boss, and Phil wants to impress daughter Haley, who has agreed to accompany him to the annual real estate banquet

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy prequel to The Big Bang Theory about nine-year-old Sheldon Cooper. He possesses a once-in-a-generation mind capable of advanced mathematics and science, but finds that gift isn't always helpful growing up in East Texas, a land where church and football are king. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: To appease his mother, who worries that he might be lonely, Sheldon employs the techniques described in a self-help book from the library in an attempt to make a friend

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny's former boyfriend Zack and his wife encounter fertility problems when wanting a baby, so ask Leonard for his help. Raj attempts to patch things up with his estranged fiancee Anu

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct by two physicists from Chicago - until the experts try to exclude Amy from their Nobel Prize nomination. Bernadette experiences a big success at work and plans for Penny to become a part of it - whether she wants to or not

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Calvin and Dave get shown up by Gemma and Marty at trivia night, so they plot to redeem themselves. Starring Cedric the Entertainer and Max Greenfield

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard becomes convinced he has met his soulmate in the form of surgeon Stephanie Barnett, but he fails to realise she is far more interested in Leonard. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj argue about what to watch on TV. Sara Rue guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally managed to find a girlfriend who meets his high standards, but his over-exuberance looks set to cause problems. Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A family trip to the school fair proves eventful for Phil and Claire, while Haley's relaxing day by the pool is interrupted by an awkward encounter with 'manny' Andy and Jay is unimpressed when Gloria signs him up for 'cop duties'

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire head to ClosetCon'13, a trade show for the closet industry, providing the perfect opportunity for Phil to find out what his father-in-law is storing in his secret room. Cam takes Lily and Mitch to the Tucker family farm, though he does not bargain on a visit from Grams (guest star Ann Guilbert), who is known for her homophobia. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Work has become so busy for Peralta and Santiago that they end up celebrating their first wedding anniversary while standing guard over a comatose drugs baron who has been rushed into hospital after being shot

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt and Peralta investigate when three valuable antique coins are stolen from the university where Kevin works as a lecturer. Meanwhile, back at the precinct, Jeffords and Santiago get competitive about taking the squad out for lunch

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny feels threatened when a sexy actress, who has landed a role in TV series CSI, moves into the apartment building, and gradually begins to sense that her friends are being manipulated by the new arrival. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco, Valerie Azlynn, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A day at the museum proves to be anything but fun when Cam, Mitch and Manny realise they can't hold their own against brainbox Alex. Claire is less than enthusiastic when she and Gloria go shopping to buy a dress for Lily, while Jay imparts some manly pearls of wisdom to grandson Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. Phil spends most of his time with his magician heroes - neglecting Claire in the process - and Mitch runs into an ex-boyfriend he dumped by e-mail, although it all seems fine when he invites Mitch and Cam to his bachelor party

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw comes to babysit when Sheldon's dad is rushed to the emergency room, but while she is sleeping the kids 'borrow' their grandmother's car and make their own way to hospital

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The youngster fears solid food after choking on a sausage, and also discovers his first comic book. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is excited to help Howard and Bernadette navigate some bureaucratic paperwork, until he discovers that they are breaking the law, leaving him with a difficult choice between following the rules or staying loyal to his friends. Leonard is disappointed when he is excluded from a scientific project his friends are working on

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tries to put a stop to Leonard's plan to be a sperm donor for her ex-boyfriend Zack's wife. Howard, Bernadette, Anu and Raj make the most of the latter's cancelled stag party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While the girls go to Disneyland and get made up as princesses, the guys have to promote science as a career option for women at Howard's old middle school. Meanwhile, Raj and Lucy have their first date in a library, where instead of speaking to each other they send text messages

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette and Howard host a dinner party, but as it falls on Sheldon's Thai food night, he opts to bring his own dinner. As punishment for his lack of manners, the gang decides he should organise Wolowitz's cluttered wardrobe, but he discovers an unopened letter from Howard's father, who hasn't made contact in years

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy takes drastic action when she believes her late husband's phone box is being removed from the village, and her behaviour worries Zara and Grace

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is flattered when a graduate student takes a shine to him, but she thinks his social life is distracting him from his work and removes him from his limited circle of friends by forcing him to work on a troublesome scientific problem. Guest starring Riki Lindhome

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: A group of social media influencer guests shake Jenna's confidence, and a relationship is on the line as an argument breaks out during dinner

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The regular gaggle of family and friends share their thoughts on shows including I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, The Great British Bake Off, The Crown, Family Fortunes, Mammals, Love Is Blind and This Morning

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes 24-year-old Sian from Norfolk, a petrol head who wants to find a man she can love more than her beloved car, and 33-year-old fashion entrepreneur Tansel from London. He is looking to settle down and hopes that losing ignoring the clothes for once will help him find the right girl

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q get stuck in a grocery sticky-note showdown, ask strangers for questionable quotes at the park, and give financial tips to unsuspecting clients

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q pose as trainees at an organic food shop and compete at a mall to untangle their phone cords, before having their trousers pulled down by a special actor

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes from November 2017, including I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, the Weakest Link Celebrity Special for Children in Need, Mary Berry's Country House Secrets, The Secret Life of the Zoo, Blue Planet II, The Theory of Everything and the News

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The regular gaggle of family and friends share their thoughts on shows including I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, The Great British Bake Off, The Crown, Family Fortunes, Mammals, Love Is Blind and This Morning

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes 24-year-old Sian from Norfolk, a petrol head who wants to find a man she can love more than her beloved car, and 33-year-old fashion entrepreneur Tansel from London. He is looking to settle down and hopes that losing ignoring the clothes for once will help him find the right girl

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: A group of social media influencer guests shake Jenna's confidence, and a relationship is on the line as an argument breaks out during dinner

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: The Butlers and Johnsons unite when a member of their community is the victim of racial injustice. American comedy, starring Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave faces off against incumbent Isaiah Evans in a debate for a city council seat, and the race comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Chris and Jodie, who are turning a broken-down camper into a cross between a mini HGV and a caravan. A couple reinvent a broken railway carriage as a rustic retreat, and for their observatory, George and Will Hardie learn how to take photos with a beer can

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George meets Amin and Amifa, whose 1920s house in Bellingham, south east London, is not just ugly - the property's DIY extension added by former owners has been condemned. The makeshift kitchen is an accident waiting to happen. The living room is dark and dingy and misaligned windows are not doing anything for its kerb appeal. Enter architect Carl Turner, who has a modest budget of 80,000 to transform this monstrosity. Can he create a contemporary, spacious and adaptable home for this rapidly growing family?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke helps unlock the potential of two houses in south London. He begins by helping NHS theatre nurse Hannah, whose Edwardian workers' cottage in Thornton Heath is so small she has had to give the only decent bedroom to her two children while she sleeps in the front room. Can he provide the luxurious master bedroom she needs? George also helps a couple renovate their Streatham home, which would not be so bad if not for the previous owners' love of glass chandeliers, Roman columns and marble-effect tiles

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hospital theatre practitioner Geoff Conway holds the first dinner party in Wigan, hoping his nine-course Spanish tapas feast will impress his fellow diners and secure him the 1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outgoing hair salon owner Natalie Crompton hosts the second dinner party in Wigan, and since she loves to party she plans a fun-filled night for her guests - including some very special treats

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Music teacher and funeral singer Alan Gregory hosts the third dinner party in Wigan, and lines up an evening of Greek food for his guests. However, his plans for a cultured soiree are soon spoiled by straight-talking Geoff Conway, who seems intent on causing arguments

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gymnastics teacher Simon Grimwood is hoping to host a special evening on the fourth night of the contest in Wigan, Greater Manchester, because it is his birthday. He wants his 'posh' menu to dazzle his guests, but salon owner Natalie Crompton is worried about some of the food on offer. The other contestants also discover his secret lifelong passion for ferreting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse practitioner Caroline Heaven hosts the final night in Wigan, hoping to end the week by showing her guests a 'proper Lancashire night'. However, hospital theatre manager Geoff Conway is on the verge of being thrown out if he continues his run of misbehaviour. At the end of proceedings the winner of the 1,000 is revealed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Shannon Slater-Dent and Trevor Tredgett's Bove Town House in Glastonbury. The duo are keen to show off what their B&B is all about, so lead an afternoon of group sound healing. While Ben Davenport and Sian Dewaal from the Fritton Arms immediately recognise that this B&B will be tough competition, Stevie King and his head chef Dave from SugarBeat Eating House dismiss the activity as being 'hippy'. However, it's the poor night's sleep that bothers Kathryn and her best friend Trevor, from Treberthan B&B, as well as the fact they have to cook their own breakfast. At feedback time, the idea of self B&B comes under fire and Kathryn doesn't hold back with her sleep score

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Treberthan B&B in Par, Cornwall, where owner Kathryn Langley and her best friend Trevor Burnell set out to give their guests a taste of Cornish hospitality. Everyone's impressed by the high standard of cleanliness, but Stevie and David are put off by the old-fashioned decor. A Cornish pasty making competition reveals Kathryn's assertive streak, while professional chef David feels under pressure to win, Ben and Sian make an unconventional pasty, and Shannon and Trevor forget a vital ingredient. At breakfast, a request for goat's milk puts Kathryn under pressure

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stevie King and his head chef David Lovett host at SugarBeat Eating House in Swainsthorpe in Norfolk. The cleanliness comes under fire as Kathryn and Trevor struggle with their marked shower screen, and Ben and Sian write a message in the dust they find. Over dinner, Ben goes into detective mode to find out everything he can about his SugarBeat rivals. However, it's Kathryn's straight talking that becomes the talking point for Shannon and Trevor

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Fritton Arms in Norfolk, run by Ben Davenport and partner Sian Dewaal. David and Stevie are upset about their feedback so they conduct a forensic-style room inspection - complete with rubber gloves - and a paddleboat race on a nearby lake brings out everyone's competitive nature. Ben impresses the guests by revealing the hotel's aristocratic connections - but soon comes under fire for allowing pets to stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners reunite to find out what they have been paid, with Shannon and Trevor from Bove Town House wanting to discuss Kathryn's comments about her poor night's sleep

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Surrey, five cooks from the Woking and Weybridge area battle to win the culinary contest's 1,000 prize. The first to host is Vincenzo Ferlita, who works in an ice-cream van. Staying true to his Italian and Sicilian roots, he hopes that his wealth of family recipes will impress his guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canadian housewife and craft-maker Sarah Maynard is second to play host in the Woking and Weybridge area, and hopes to impress her guests by serving up a three-course Turkish feast. However, the lavish spread needs a lot of preparation time, and she must hope it turns out as presentable as she plans it to be

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Riot policeman Steve Carvill hosts the third dinner party in Woking and Weybridge in Surrey, and hopes that a night of fine food and fun will impress his guests. He takes no prisoners with his menu, rustling up home-made pasta and white chocolate panna cotta from scratch for his four unsuspecting diners, who are expecting fast food rather than fine dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of gardener Sara Gilding on the fourth night in Woking and Weybridge in Surrey, but it is her first time hosting a dinner party in more than 20 years. Guest Vincenzo Ferlita is not looking forward to the evening, while Steve Carvill hopes he will get some respite from Sara's flirtatious advances

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Children's entertainer Kelly Cummins hosts the final party from Woking and Weybridge in Surrey, and the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced. The guests keep their fingers crossed that dog-loving Sara Gilding does not return to her critical ways, while a bout of flatulence provides some comic relief

programme.title: Chateau DIY: Living the Dream
programme.desc: Revisiting musicians Ben and Billie, who bought Chteau La Grande Maison near the Loire Valley 12 years ago and live there with their daughter Ella. The programme showcases the fantastic makeover of the old ballroom, the launch a new dining area in the orangery, the launch of their glamping site in the grounds, and a very special event for their friends

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: One-off special in which paramedics respond to reports of a patient in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, there's no answer at the door. Concerned that an elderly relative is attempting CPR inside, they break down two sets of doors to gain entry. Inside they discover an exhausted wife who, despite her own physical problems, has been trying to save her husband's life. Elsewhere, a PE lesson at school ends abruptly when a young boy has an epileptic seizure

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Catriona is worried that a man might lose his sight after an awful workplace accident. Dr George and Dr Rosie need to electrocute the heart of a father of two, and a racetrack worker needs all of Dr Michelle's skills after a freak quad-bike accident.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, the heli-medics are dispatched to a motocross track where Mike has come off his bike, falling over 10 feet, and is experiencing altered sensations in both legs. In another motorcycle accident, Luke suffers a serious femur fracture and a piece of his bone is lying on the road. Near Kendal, Moon has a tonic-clonic seizure; and there's drama on the ambulance journey to hospital

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: The team takes on the case of a young boy from Africa who has severe congenital heart anomalies, but Dr Melendez has doubts about the safety of the procedure

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: One-off special in which paramedics respond to reports of a patient in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, there's no answer at the door. Concerned that an elderly relative is attempting CPR inside, they break down two sets of doors to gain entry. Inside they discover an exhausted wife who, despite her own physical problems, has been trying to save her husband's life. Elsewhere, a PE lesson at school ends abruptly when a young boy has an epileptic seizure

In another motorcycle accident, Luke suffers a serious femur fracture and a piece of his bone is lying on the road. Near Kendal, Moon has a tonic-clonic seizure; and there's drama on the ambulance journey to hospital

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ex-RAF officers Simon Stenning and Amanda Butcher have been visiting the Caribbean island of Antigua for several years, and now hope to find the perfect winter home there. Ben Hillman helps the pair, showing them five properties for their 330,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gary and Carol from Kent first fell in love with rural Aquitaine in France while on holiday and now want to start a new chapter in their lives by making it their permanent home. House-hunting expert Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect property within their 120,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple launch a luxury B&B in France with a toddler in tow, while a microbrewery in Murcia aims to crack the Spanish lager market

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Dumfries and Galloway to memorabilia heaven. Simon spots an unloved corner unit at a charity depot that he plans on upcycling

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Pembrokeshire to meet a cattle breeder whose barns include a pair of discarded horns, and a camper van fan with a vintage pedal car

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers search for heirs on a huge family tree, and spend days trying to track them down. Plus, the investigation into a former civil servant's 160,000 estate, and details of more unclaimed properties

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company tries to find beneficiaries to the 400,000 estate of a woman from Enfield, before hearing news that threatens the whole investigation. Elsewhere, the case of a missing man who lived in a shed for 20 years, who left behind a full military pension and substantial savings. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are still to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Richard III in Middleham, North Yorkshire, a pub run by Ken Ward and his wife Sharon, who become suspicious when one couple check out before breakfast. The village is known for its horse racing links, but one of the competitors, Matt Wilson, has a fear of horses, and another couple are concerned at staying above a noisy pub

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Court House Unique Boutique B&B in Shelsley Walsh, Worcestershire, where hosts Keith and Lisa Shearin hope to impress. On arrival, Ken and Sharon are blown away by their honeymoon suite and the seemingly low price. Suspicions over price fixing drive Matt and Paul to the internet to verify the room rate, where they discover an anomaly, and despite Keith's best efforts at breakfast, Jo and Louis dismiss it as being too fancy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Castley Camp in Otley, West Yorkshire, for the third day of the contest, owned by single mum Jo Stevenson and her son Louis. Some of the guests are horrified by stains on their bedding and dust in their room, while an afternoon boot camp fitness session reveals Keith's competitive side. At feedback, Jo is left fuming over the comments about cleanliness and breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at the Lion & Swan in Congleton, Cheshire, run by owner Paul Whyle and manager Matt Wilson. A dirty bathroom and a waterbed cause upset, while some guests are still fuming about previous negative feedback. However, the worst is left for breakfast, when Sharon reveals she has discovered their rooms online at a higher price than they were told, upsetting Keith and Lisa and leaving the hosts determined to clear their names

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. First up are Ken and Sharon from the Richard III, who want to learn more about what's been causing Jo and Louis to lose sleep. Next, Keith and Lisa from the Court House Unique Boutique B&B want to challenge Matt about the allegations of price fixing and vehemently fight their corner. Needless to say, there is tension in the air and axes to grind, before the winner is revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Series following a British family through the process of buying and restoring a French chateau that has been empty for the past four decades. Dick Strawbridge and his partner Angel Adoree's new home has 12 acres of land, nine outbuildings, a walled garden and a moat - but it also has no electricity, heating or water, and proves to be a far more complicated DIY project than expected

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. In the first episode, a terrified terrier known as Tiny arrives after his owner of five years is taken into care, while child-friendly Daisy, a Cairn terrier, is the only one of Wood Green's charges deemed gentle enough for the Kerry family from Peterborough. Plus, Jack Russell Mozart and Zeus, a recently abandoned Staffordshire bull terrier, each try to charm couple Paul and Elf

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After recovering from a life-threatening brain haemorrhage, Bram Vis, along with his wife Lisa, sets out to build a house for them and their two children on a seaside plot on the Isle of Wight. Kevin McCloud follows the family's progress as they build an ambitious home complete with entertaining spaces and a swimming pool. However, the sheer scale of their project soon becomes clear when their original 850,000 budget spirals out of control

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on carpenter Mike's 1980 Ford Escort RS2000. After his son's road accident, Mike's family want to repay his selfless devotion and give him the Car SOS treatment

programme.title: Inside Jaguar: Making a Million Pound Car
programme.desc: Mark Evans follows the creation of the Lightweight E-type, the manufacturer's most expensive car ever, finding out exactly what goes into building a vehicle fit for a millionaire. Plans were made for 18 of the cars to be built back in 1963, but only 12 were ever produced - and now another six are being put together by specialist engineers to finally finish the project. However, the presenter discovers that not everyone is happy with the situation

programme.title: Billion Pound Cruise
programme.desc: Compilation episode taking a look behind the scenes of the Symphony of the Seas, the most creative-thinking and mammoth ship ever built. It features some of the 2,200 crew members that work around the clock to keep 6,680 holidaymakers happy. The ship boasts 20 pools and jacuzzis, two surf simulators, a rock climbing wall, an ice rink, a basketball court and a mini-golf course

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients whose visions of the world are rocked by life-changing events, including 44-year-old Sergio, who is flown in by air ambulance after a cycling accident. Another cyclist - 71-year-old Alan - arrives in resus after being in a collision with a van. Doctors suspect a head injury and multiple fractures. Alan's wife Jenny reveals how she met him and how a sudden accident involving her son burst their idyll and took their lives on an unexpected path

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd taking on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients whose visions of the world are rocked by life-changing events, including 44-year-old Sergio, who is flown in by air ambulance after a cycling accident. Another cyclist - 71-year-old Alan - arrives in resus after being in a collision with a van. Doctors suspect a head injury and multiple fractures. Alan's wife Jenny reveals how she met him and how a sudden accident involving her son burst their idyll and took their lives on an unexpected path

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Angela Keenan and Jon Benbow-Brown have visited Menorca five times together, and have fallen in love with the laid-back way of life on the island. The pair are planning to retire there full-time, so Ben Hillman shows them five houses on the island for their budget of 165,000

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: In this bite-sized episode, Kirstie Allsopp plans to surprise her guests with two main courses - roast beef with mulled wine gravy, and masala cauliflower with coconut stuffing for the vegetarians

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies shows Gary and Linda five properties within their budget of 85,000 to choose between, in the area around Manilva in southern Spain. Buying a home to share with their wider family has been a long-held dream of the Lincolnshire couple

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: B&B owners in France juggle a busy diary with the pressures of parenthood. In Spain, a microbrewery ramps up promotion, and a couple in France create face cream from snail slime

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Gemma turns an old TV cabinet into a luxury dog bed, while Henry trades in his lifelong love of mechanicals to upcycle wooden furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Oxford to meet Rosemary, whose father owned a second-hand goods shop. They discover a servant's call bell and a mysterious pedal-powered tool, which Simon is anxious to restore

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a man who spent the last years of his life on the Essex coast, and the search for his relatives leads the heir hunters to Wales. Plus, members of a family who have connections to 19th-century transatlantic communications, and details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers go to extreme lengths in their search for the relatives of a man from Ealing, west London. Plus, a case uncovers a connection to a serial killer arrested by the Metropolitan Police Service, and an American vaudeville performer who became a celebrity in London

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets under way at the Oak Tree Cottage in Burley, Hampshire, where owner Jacqui Castle and her sidekick Jane Waters hope the homely approach will win the day. Guests Martin and Catherine Crosswaite are not encouraged by the shared facilities, while breakfast served at a communal table is not to the liking of Norman Butcher and Lorraine Watkins

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Bath's the Rising Sun Inn, where owners Lorraine Hawkins and Norman Butcher hope to bring their guests up to standard by having a dress code. Following their feedback on the last visit, Jacqui and Jane take an extra critical eye to the rooms, while Martin and Catherine show their competitive streak during a boules match

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Busfeild Arms in East Morton for the third day of the contest, where hosts Martin and Catherine Croswaite pride themselves in giving great Yorkshire hospitality. Jacqui is overwhelmed by the luxury and extras in the rooms, which raises questions about how the owners make a profit. Meanwhile, Martin shocks the group by sharing his stunt motorbike riding past, and later, Patrick feels the pressure of being the final host

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stopover is at Patrick Duggan's Beatles-themed Epstein House in Liverpool, the former home of band manager Brian Epstein's father. Jacqui and Jane are unimpressed by unpleasant smells in the bedroom, while Martin and Catherine show they will do anything to win during a game of Fab Four charades. At dinner, Patrick shocks his guests when he reveals his idea of the ideal woman. Will it have an effect on their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Jacqui and Jane from the Oak Tree Cottage want to find out why Norman and Lorraine wouldn't return, while Martin and Catherine from the Busfeild Arms have some explaining to do when it comes to their profit margins. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: The plumbers race to install basic heating and water as Dick, Angel and the Strawbridge family decide it's time to move into their crumbling chateau. They'll be sharing their new home with bats, birds and thousands of flies, but Angel is in love with their new home and the clan begins the process of adjusting to French country life

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A Liverpool family face a difficult decision choosing which one of a litter of 10 German shepherd puppies to take home with them. The Woodgreen staff also hope a Staffordshire bull terrier, brought in by social services after an incident in its previous home, will be able to find a more understanding owner, and a Yorkshire terrier with a big attitude tries to win over a couple

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows software executive Andy and garden designer Nicki, who are planning to build a 'floating' house on the Thames, which would be the first of its kind in the UK. Their architect has come up with an ambitious, experimental design that would see the whole property magically rise up with the flood waters. However, no one knows whether it will work, and the project soon becomes bogged down in the logistical challenges of bringing to fruition such a complex structure on a small island that is only accessible by a narrow footbridge

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Maureen, who's 66, is rushed to St George's struggling to breathe through her tracheostomy. Nurse Christine battles to clear her airway, while Maureen's husband Preston waits in the relatives' room. As doctors carry out further investigations, Preston joins Maureen and it's revealed how their world was turned upside down when Maureen was diagnosed with the neurological condition multiple system atrophy. Ten-year-old Ryan is brought into resus having fallen at school and suffered internal bleeding

programme.title: Brain Surgeons: Between Life and Death
programme.desc: In this episode, 30-year-old Dan and 39-year-old Laura must undergo surgery while remaining awake, allowing the surgeons to map the functioning of their brains. For Dan and Laura and their families, the question remains: will they be the same people after the surgery is completed? Detailed computer-generated graphics animating the MRI scans reveal how the specific functions of the patients' brains have been affected, casting new light on the mysteries and marvels of the brain

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance crews race to help a teenage motorcyclist who has been hit by a car and catapulted into the air - suffering multiple fractures to his legs and arms. On holiday in Cumbria, a man collapses while working out and his stepdaughter performs CPR to try to keep him alive. A driver suffers a nasty leg wound after being hit from behind on the M40 - and to make matters worse, he is trapped in his lorry

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: One-off special in which paramedics respond to reports of a patient in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, there's no answer at the door. Concerned that an elderly relative is attempting CPR inside, they break down two sets of doors to gain entry. Inside they discover an exhausted wife who, despite her own physical problems, has been trying to save her husband's life. Elsewhere, a PE lesson at school ends abruptly when a young boy has an epileptic seizure

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio are in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Maureen, who's 66, is rushed to St George's struggling to breathe through her tracheostomy. Nurse Christine battles to clear her airway, while Maureen's husband Preston waits in the relatives' room. As doctors carry out further investigations, Preston joins Maureen and it's revealed how their world was turned upside down when Maureen was diagnosed with the neurological condition multiple system atrophy. Ten-year-old Ryan is brought into resus having fallen at school and suffered internal bleeding

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was just nine. Now, she's ready to return to her roots with her husband Ian, by buying a holiday home together on the island she left almost 50 years ago. With a budget of 360,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five properties boasting views of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: Secrets of the Supercars
programme.desc: The armoured BMW X5 is the perfect hybrid of when armoured cars meet supercars. Titch Cormack reveals just what it takes to design and build a car that can come under enemy attack

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Ione gives Barry and Darren the run-around in Lincolnshire as host Sean Kelly reveals the hidden gems of more storage lockers

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Milton Keynes, where portable toilets are up for grabs. Scotty, Heavy D, Linda, Nat and John also fight for the biggest gains in a Dutch auction

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are looking for treasure in Somerset's storage units, where a bouncy castle and an air boat are among the finds

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jack Dee, Romesh Ranganathan, Gaby Roslin and Tinchy Stryder join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer head to Norfolk, where they attempt to ensnare a large pike - a fish that has eluded them on their trips so far. As they arrive and get their gear together, Bob introduces Paul to the surprisingly varied contents of his car boot, much to Paul's amusement. They gather their equipment and find a decent spot that should give them plenty of chances to catch and make camp for the day. They end their trip with a visit to a local pub, where Bob reveals a hidden trick

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for brown trout on the river Test in Hampshire, using a Victorian fly-casting technique pioneered in the area as well as an authentic 19th-century rod. The Mayflies are hatching, and the famously short-lived insects inspire some thoughts on the ephemeral nature of life, and what they would do if they only had 24 hours left

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer go fishing for crucian carp in Wiltshire, a notoriously elusive fish that is usually only sighted at either dusk or dawn. They spend the night in a deconsecrated church, where Paul shares a new song that he is working on, while Bob brings a new fishing chair to the river that Paul does not approve of

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fish for chub on the river Wye in Herefordshire, Bob making an unexpected arrival by rowing boat. They are joined on today's trip by Dr Anand Patel from the Centre for Men's Health for a discussion of medical matters, and spend the night in a converted dovecote in the idyllic grounds of a 700-year-old manor house

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

He then begins to head inland, visiting Burgundy for a memorable glass of Auxey-Duresses wine, and sampling oeuf en meurette with a difference. Following a memorable Sunday lunch near the French/Swiss border, he is inspired to recreate a traditional blueberry tart
